meanings.definition: A heavy stick carried by police officers for use as a weapon.
meanings.sent1: The police officer held his nightstick firmly during the patrol.
meanings.sent2: The nightstick is an essential tool for law enforcement officers.
meanings.sent3: Why did the nightstick break up with the flashlight? It wanted some space!
meanings.sent4: The nightstick became a symbol of authority in the officer's hand.
meanings.sent5: The gleam of the nightstick under the streetlight sent a warning signal.

meanings.definition: To strike or beat with a nightstick.
meanings.sent1: The officer had to nightstick the door to break it down.
meanings.sent2: He decided to nightstick the criminal who was resisting arrest.
meanings.sent3: When the piñata wouldn't break, they nightsticked it for candy!
meanings.sent4: The storm nightsticked the trees, leaving a trail of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The boxer nightsticks the punching bag to improve his strength.
